moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4: The most popular opening of the day. Black has to accept: to do otherwise would be ungentlemanly!
moves.3. Nf3 g5 4. Bc4 g4 5. O-O: The Muzio Gambit. White sacrifices a piece for the attack.
moves.5... Qe7 6. Nc3 Qc5+ 7. d4 Qxc4: Black takes the Bishop instead of the Knight.
moves.11... f6 12. Qxg4 fxe5: Yet another sacrifice, and Anderssen accepts.
moves.13. Qh5+ Qg6 14. Qxe5+ Ne7: White is closing in. If Black can hold out, his material advantage will be decisive.
moves.15. Rxf8+: Yet another sacrifice, and this one finally breaks the back of Black's defensive position.
moves.17. Nf6+: Forcing Black to give up his Queen.
moves.17... Qxf6 18. Qxf6: Now it is White with the material edge. The inevitable happens...
moves.18... h5 19. Bh6: ...and Black resigns. A splendid attack by Zuckertort.

opening: KGA (C37), Muzio gambit, Kling and Horwitz counter-attack
